H0.text: What was the name given to the synthetic material which was the fore-runner to today's modern plastic. Celluloid

H1.text: What was the name given to the synthetic material which was the fore-runner to today's modern plastic. Parkesine

H2.text: What was the name given to the synthetic material which was the fore-runner to today's modern plastic. Vulcanite

H3.text: What was the name given to the synthetic material which was the fore-runner to today's modern plastic. Bakelite

A4.text: celluloid became the common use term used for this type of plastic

A5.text: Parkesine was made from cellulose treated with nitric acid and a solvent

A6.text: The introduction of Parkesine is generally regarded as the birth of the plastics industry

A7.text: The first celluloid as a bulk material for forming objects was made in 1855 by Alexander Parkes
